second_reading.title: Second Letter to Timothy
second_reading.text:
[[2_Tm 2,8]]Beloved: Remember Jesus Christ, raised from the dead, a descendant of David: such is my gospel,
[[2_Tm 2,9]]for which I am suffering, even to the point of chains, like a criminal. But the word of God is not chained.
[[2_Tm 2,10]]Therefore, I bear with everything for the sake of those who are chosen, so that they too may obtain the salvation that is in Christ Jesus, together with eternal glory.
[[2_Tm 2,11]]This saying is trustworthy: If we have died with him we shall also live with him;
[[2_Tm 2,12]]if we persevere we shall also reign with him. But if we deny him he will deny us.
[[2_Tm 2,13]]If we are unfaithful he remains faithful, for he cannot deny himself.

first_reading.title: 2nd book of Kings
first_reading.text:
[[2_R 5,14]]Naaman went down and plunged into the Jordan seven times at the word of Elisha, the man of God. His flesh became again like the flesh of a little child, and he was clean of his leprosy.
[[2_R 5,15]]He returned with his whole retinue to the man of God. On his arrival he stood before him and said, "Now I know that there is no God in all the earth, except in Israel. Please accept a gift from your servant."
[[2_R 5,16]]"As the LORD lives whom I serve, I will not take it," Elisha replied; and despite Naaman's urging, he still refused.
[[2_R 5,17]]Naaman said: "If you will not accept, please let me, your servant, have two mule-loads of earth, for I will no longer offer holocaust or sacrifice to any other god except to the LORD.

psalm.title: Psalms
psalm.text:
[[Ps 98,1]]Sing to the LORD a new song, 
for he has done wondrous deeds; 
His right hand has won victory for him, 
his holy arm.

[[Ps 98,2]]The LORD has made his salvation known: 
in the sight of the nations he has revealed his justice.
[[Ps 98,3]]Has remembered faithful love 
toward the house of Israel. 

All the ends of the earth have seen 
the salvation by our God.
[[Ps 98,4]]Sing joyfully to the LORD, all you lands; 
break into song; sing praise.

gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Luke
gospel.text:
[[Lc 17,11]]As Jesus continued his journey to Jerusalem, he traveled through Samaria and Galilee.
[[Lc 17,12]]As he was entering a village, ten lepers met him. They stood at a distance from him
[[Lc 17,13]]and raised their voice, saying, "Jesus, Master! Have pity on us!"
[[Lc 17,14]]And when he saw them, he said, "Go show yourselves to the priests." As they were going they were cleansed.
[[Lc 17,15]]And one of them, realizing he had been healed, returned, glorifying God in a loud voice;
[[Lc 17,16]]and he fell at the feet of Jesus and thanked him. He was a Samaritan.
[[Lc 17,17]]Jesus said in reply, "Ten were cleansed, were they not? Where are the other nine?
[[Lc 17,18]]Has none but this foreigner returned to give thanks to God?"
[[Lc 17,19]]Then he said to him, "Stand up and go; your faith has saved you."
